snippet: The commander of American military forces in the Pacific region said warships equipped with advanced radar and other ballistic-missile defense systems were being relocated to monitor a potential rocket launching by North Korea.
abstract: Adm Samuel J Locklear III, commander of American military forces in Pacific region, says warships equipped with advanced radar and other ballistic-missile defense systems are being relocated to monitor potential rocket launching by North Korea; stresses that launching of long-range missile would violate United Nations Security Council resolutions.
lead_paragraph: The commander of American military forces in the Pacific region said warships equipped with advanced radar and other ballistic-missile defense systems were being relocated to monitor a potential rocket launching by North Korea.

headline.seo: U.S. Military to Monitor North Korean Rocket Launching
headline.main: U.S. Military to Monitor for Rocket
headline.print_headline: U.S. Military To Monitor For Rocket
